pull.title: mempool: Clear vTxHashes when mapTx is cleared
pull.body: vTxHashes is a vector of all entries in mapTx, if you clear one you should clear the other, lest someone try to use the txiter in vTxHashes which would result in a segfault.

events.body:
light code review ACK 2902780

Perhaps someone with more historical insight should look at this as well. I can't find a reason for `vTxHashes` to not be cleared. It looks like it was introduced this way in 811902649d6aaddd886cb39b83aa69adf7b441bd.
It might be better to remove the whole function instead. See #20030 and then #19909

> It might be better to remove the whole function instead. See #20030 and then #19909

Oh, agree. Is #19909 up for grabs?
#19909 is the trivial part, #20030 is the tougher one to review even though it only changes on line. I can reopen it later today.
Regardless of removing the whole function later, this seems to be a good idea and should be reviewed/merged for backport benefit.

events.message: Clear vTxHashes when mapTx is cleared

events.body:
Code review ACK 9d65ad365c539557e969a35d22723d92e0b422fe
This makes sense for consistency. As long as there is a clear function it makes sense to clear everything and not forget this. Also agree on the long-run goal of removing it in favor of safer approaches.

rename.from: Clear vTxHashes when mapTx is cleared
rename.to: mempool: Clear vTxHashes when mapTx is cleared

comments.body: Just for the sake of not having invalid iterators even temporarily, I prefer this before mapTx is cleared.
Updated to move vTxHashes clear before mapTx clear.
